key_points: Delta plus is a new coronavirus variant, a mutation of the delta variant, which is highly contagious and responsible for 93% of cases in the US.
The delta plus variant has been classified as a 'variant of concern' in India due to its potential to bind better to lung cells and possibly evade COVID treatments.
Delta plus has been detected in several countries, including the US, the UK, Portugal, Russia, China, and South Korea.
The 'plus' in delta plus refers to the K417N spike protein mutation, which may make some COVID-19 treatments less effective.
So far, delta plus has not been shown to be more transmissible or dominant over the original delta variant.
Virologist Dr. Gagandeep Kang emphasizes the need for more research to determine if delta plus poses a greater risk of severe disease.
Public health policy modeler Colin Angus notes there's no clear evidence that delta plus has gained a foothold over existing variants.
Dr. Anthony Fauci warns as long as a significant portion of the population remains unvaccinated, the virus will continue to mutate.
There are currently no 'variants of high consequence' but the potential exists for future variants to evade vaccines and cause more severe disease.
Fauci stresses the importance of widespread vaccination not only for individual protection but for the larger community's safety.
spokespersons: Dr. Anthony Fauci (US President Joe Biden's Medical Advisor)
